Reviews.Title: “Ecxellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireScots
Reviews.Content: I have only good things to say about this hotel. It is so conveniently located right off Union Square, Fabulous choice of restaurants all within walking distance and an array of shops too. We had a military rate of $149 per night which is the members' rate, parking is a very short walk away and is $27 per day if you stay in the hotel. You can take your car in and out for no extra charge. Breakfast is included in the cost as is the 4-6pm happy hour which makes this a very good deal! Both are served on the 12th floor which has stunning views over the city. The staff are very helpful and friendly. We had a king room which was very spacious with a huge closet which had a full sized fridge and coffee making facilities. The bathroom is on the small side but perfectly adequate and spotlessly clean. The style of the hotel is older but that is part of its charm. There is a lovely library with a fire to relax by. We did not use the gym facilities or the pool so cannot comment on that aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel inSan Francisco”
Reviews.Author: JSarbello
Reviews.Content: March 20-22, 2012. 1st time staying here & not the last. My corner king room facing Mason & Sutter was quite large with lots of natural light. Bed was very comfortable. Construction outside was noisy, but not the hotel's fault. The windows had plantation shutters for a very nice touch. I stayed as a guest of a member. I arrived early and there was no problem holding my luggage til I was ready. The Club has a discount for garaged parking just up the street with in/out privileges. Happy hour at the restaurant/bar on the top floor is NOT to be missed, either is the complimentary breakfast with the best views in this area of the city. The history is spectacular, I stayed on the 5th floor with all of the plaques of fallen marines. The Club Room on the 11th floor is not to be missed either, such tradition! The hotel is convenient to the trolleys, Chinatown, Japantown - basically everything. The people I met staying at the hotel were very cordial, professional and extremely pleasant to socialize. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Step into History”
Reviews.Author: Redhawk_Marine
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I ever stayed at the Marine Memorial Club Hotel, and still experienced the same thrill as when I stayed there the first time. The history surrounding this Hotel is amazing and is located in the middle of downtown San Francisco. The reception area is filled with history and great displays. The Library is absolutely amazing and we got to visit a few days before Christmas and got to see the awesome Christmas tree display. The breakfast the next morning in Leatherneck Steakhouse was absolutely wonderful. It made me laugh because the buffet has gourmet versions of some of the dishes from the military I used to have along with the mini bottles of Tabasco to go with it. If I ever get a chance to return to San Francisco again, I will always stay here if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best.”
Reviews.Author: LoveANiceHotel
Reviews.Content: Week of 3/12/2012. My small room and tiny bathroom were not clean. The windows are old and drafty so there was lots of street noise and a constant chill. There is no surface in the bathroom to place toiletries. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: veronica030
Reviews.Content: Great location, free happy hour, good breakfast. Restaurant has amazing city views and the best customer service. Will definitely recommend and return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “SF's Best Kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: SpaChick5000
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place! I have stayed at MMC on many occasions, and each time it just gets better and better. The staff is genuinely friendly and hospitable, always smiling, happy and ready to help. I appreciate seeing the same faces year after year, including the General Manager who is always so attentive and consistently goes above and beyond to make guests feel special and welcome. The location of the property is fantastic, within close proximity to many of the city's major destinations and attractions. Very convenient, with the ability to walk for shopping, dining, sight seeing or catching a cable car or taxi. The rooms are spacious and all of the facilities are very well-maintained. I am impressed with the amenities and appointments in each room, and with Housekeeping's attentiveness. There's a great business center and a fantastic gym. I also love the restaurant, which features great views and wonderful food. The included breakfast and happy hour is a great value, and a rare offering in hotels these days. Most importantly, I always feel very safe at MMC, which is critical as a female who primarily travels alone. I would recommend MMC to anyone-- families, business travelers, leisure travelers... Thanks for another memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pinkdolphi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week long conference. The hotel was very clean and our double room was quite large. It is a short walk uphill from union square - yay. Decorations were all very interesting - marine memorabilia. I loved that there was a room mini-fridge, free breakfast (one type of breakfast meat a day, fresh pastries, fruit, etc), & free happy hour. Their orange juice was super delicious. Don't forget money for tips. If you don't have time for a sit down breakfast, pastries, fruit, tea, & coffee are available in the business center. I spent a lot of time studying for class on this trip and the business office or library were fabulous places for that. My only complaint: The last night, there was some huge party upstairs. Since we were the topmost floor with hotel rooms, the noise came through super loud - The DJ had the base at ridiculous levels. The front desk did offer to upgrade us to a larger suite that was quiet. Very nice staff :) At night, the street noise was really noticeable to me - not uncomfortable/bothersome, just noticeable - but keep in mind that I'd just spent the last year living in relatively rural Fairbanks.

Reviews.Title: “First class service”
Reviews.Author: H1022
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the hotel and it was as good as the first time. The hotel is for veterans who qualify for membership. As before the price was right, inexpensive compared to others of the same quality. My room was spacious with anew hd tv and very a very comfortable lounge chair with ottoman. Two of the benefits that give added value are the free full breakfast and happy hour. If you qualify, you should consider joining.

Reviews.Title: “Leatherneck's Steakhouse”
Reviews.Author: ocall0
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying I did not stay at the Marine's Memorial Club, but I did eat at the excellent Leatherneck's Steakhouse on the 12th floor. Magnificent nighttime view of the city, attentive service and a superb, moderately priced steak was my reward. I would HIGHLY recommend this restaurant to anyone staying around Union Square area in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff in a beautifully clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: toni526
Reviews.Content: Wonderful 3 night stay in this excellent hotel. Stopped in room 301. Staff were sooooo nice and very helpful. Room was very clean and breakfast was beautiful. The whole place is soaked in history and it was a pleasure to be able to access all that the hotel had to offer and for us to remember a dear friend which was part of the marine corps. Thank you very much. Looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ivy1954
Reviews.Content: MMC is always a good choice. The front desk staff and the bellmen/concierge were all very friendly, professional and helpful. Our room was fine, bathroom was small and somewhat dated, but very clean. Best part was that the window opened! The refrigerator, which was in the closet, was much appreciated. The breakfast and "happy hour" are a plus, and one of the reasons we return, but they could use a little fine tuning. The breakfast wait staff were all friendly and efficient. I don't understand why they only have the toasters out on the weekends. And new toasters would not be a budget buster, it takes several minutes for a slice of toast to even get partially done. The evening cocktail hour was a mixed bag. The view is spectacular from the 12th floor, so why they don't turn down the lights, put a few candles on the tables and let people relax and enjoy it is beyond me. The wait staff is busy, but one night out of three were they at all friendly and welcoming. Good service equals good tips. The "hosts" at the entrance bordered on rude, never a smile or a greeting.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet elegance, great service, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: GOarmywife
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Memorial several times and are always impressed. The service is impeccable, the rooms are spacious and well appointed and the location is wonderful for shopping, dining and sight seeing. Regrettably, there were issues with the hot water supply three out of four mornings. The management comped our rooms (two suites), which was most kind and appreciated. The hosted breakfast and happy hour are both very nice. We hosted a dinner for twenty while there and all had a delicious meal with top notch service. When our travels take us to San Francisco, we will again call on the Memorial.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay; I could overlook minor issues for only $80 a night”
Reviews.Author: brettandanne
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at MMC for the first time the week before Christmas with my husband and two sons, who are 6 years old. By showing my husband's military ID when we checked in, our rate was reduced from $199 per night to $80 per night. What a great value! This price included our room which was adequately sized (by downtown San Francisco standards) and a buffet breakfast each morning on the 12th floor with a great view of downtown SF. For $27 a night, we parked our car in a garage which was about 50 yards up the street. Again, this was a great value, as most hotels in the surrounding area charged upwards of $50 per night to park a car. Our room included bathrobes, two double beds, an alarm clock, a coffee maker, a small fridge, and a hairdryer in the bathroom. The room did not have a DVD player and the pay-per-view movies were incredibly expensive, which was sort of a bummer for my sons. Also, our window looked directly out to a brick wall of the hotel next door. Some of the interior of the hotel was a little dated, and the nightly happy hour was always too crowded for us to attend. At $80 a night, I can't really call any of these things "complaints" because it's easy to overlook minor issues when you're getting such a deal. Had we paid the full rate, I would have wanted a nicer view and expected some nicer finishes here and there in our room and the common areas of the hotel. The only major reservation I have about recommending this hotel to people is that it wasn't the most comfortable place to stay with small children. My kids are pretty well behaved, and we travel with them a lot, but I still found myself "shushing" them and telling them to be quiet, sit up straight; etc. The hotel is frequented largely by retired military, and there weren't a whole lot of families there. This made the atmosphere feel a little stuffy. As a matter of fact, one morning, the breakfast buffet was especially crowded, and after we finished eating and got back on the elevator, one lady in the elevator remarked to another that the buffet was too crowded because "there were a lot of families in the hotel right now". I kept my mouth shut, but I actually thought it was the older folks up there drinking their coffees and reading newspapers that slowed things down. If you've ever eaten at a restaurant with small kids, you know that families usually eat and leave, and don't dawdle at the table. Plus, there were really only 3 or 4 small families of 4 in the dining room (including ours) during the time that we were there for breakfast. Her comment let me know that even a small amount of smaller sized families was an anomaly for the MMC hotel. Bearing that in mind, we will definitely go back to MMC again. The location was so great (we walked to Union Square to go ice skating) that you end up not spending a lot of time in the hotel, so even though it wasn't the most kid-friendly hotel, we still enjoyed our stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great military benefit!”
Reviews.Author: debedmtzIllinois
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Nice rooms with free happy hour in the bar

Reviews.Title: “Best place for your money in SF”
Reviews.Author: travelfoster
Reviews.Content: If you are active duty expect to pay 40% less than everyone as long as you show your active duty I.D. This place is clean, spacious, comfortable beds, free happy hour from 4-6 and free full on breakfast buffet. The food is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel in Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: lineri
Reviews.Content: This is very near Union Square, a cable car stop and a bus stop. It is a very short walk to shopping and dining in the Union Square district. Some of the rooms are small but very clean and with very good beds and bedding.They have a hosted happy hour every nigh from 4 to 6 pm. A full buffett breakfast is served every morning. You have free access to a gym and indooor pool which is accessible withut going outside the building. Service is outstanding. We look forwrd to going here at least twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in SF”
Reviews.Author: ESSIrvine
Reviews.Content: Marines Memorial Club is a hidden Gem in San Francisco. The hotel had a very reasonable rate, good location, and free breakfast and happy hour. The room and bed were comfortable. The only downside to the hotel was the smallness of the room and bathroom; however, larger rooms would easily cost >$150-200. Otherwise, everything was fantastic. I appreciated the environmental sensitivity of the hotel and the courteousness of the hotel staff. I will definitely stay here again for my next conference at Moscone Center.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act”
Reviews.Author: abinaz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at half dozen different boutique hotes in S.F. and this is by far the best on every level. Location is great, just two blocks from Union Square. The rate, which was competitive, includes a full breakfast buffet, an open bar happy hour (actually two hours), and use of a full fitness club complete with lap-swimming pool. My corner room had excellent views, and no internal noise (of course street noise is part of the downtown S.F. landscape), The room was very clean, nicely appointed, and very comfortable. The service was excellent. I am not military, but enjoyed the numerous Marines Memorial Association displays. I would definitely recommend MMCH and plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jbailey25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the end of October for four nights. Our room was spacious, the bed was comfortable, but the bathroom and TV reception were less than we are used to. Overall, the hotel needs to be updated. The breakfast buffet was very good. We missed Happy Hour, but we hear it is fun. Staff and buffet waiters are excellent. We would most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marianne337
Reviews.Content: Our daughter had her wedding at the hotel. Many quests stayed at the hotel. All where happy with the accommodations as well as the delicious breakfast buffet and happy hour to meet everyone. The wedding was excellent. Everything was done very professionally. Our daughter lives in San Francisico. The wedding planner was very efficient and made everything easy for her. The staff was helpful to all our quests since we are from the East coast. They got cabs for us, gave his directions to restaurants, and shuttles to the airport.The hotel is centrally located to many attractions. If you went on Greyline Tours, they picked you up and back after the tour. We all enjoyed the Red and Line tour to see the Blue Angels and other planes. We had a buffet with sandwiches, salad desserts. There was plenty of food for everyone to enjoy. The movie tour of the movies filmed in San Francisco was also enjoyable. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Only Pros - Definitely Recommend Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: Kpen9
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and quiet hotel. It is close to Union Square and the Hyde./Powell Streets trolley and in walking distance to Chinatown. The staff was very friendly and helpful with recommendations. The complimentary breakfast buffet was excellent and they had free cocktails and snacks from 4PM to 6PM. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Stay In San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: PeggyBeier
Reviews.Content: We've been members of the Club for many years and have had many wonderful vacations while staying there. The Staff are all exceptional, from top to bottom! The rooms are always comfortable and nicely appointed. We always have everything we need while staying there. The complementary breakfast each morning is always so very good and dinners in the restaurant are terrific, including the views from the top of this grand hotel! This place is the BEST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service”
Reviews.Author: TeddingtonGreen
Reviews.Content: I read the many positive reviews before booking and wasnâ€™t disappointed. Our 2 rooms were clean and well equipped. We missed the happy hour on our first day but didnâ€™t make that mistake again; great company with a fantastic view, and live music! Breakfast was substantial. Our tours during the day, and trips out for dinner were made easy by the central location. And after check out we picked up our Avis car from just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: ald656
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for a friend's wedding. Unsure of what to expect with "The Marine Club" - we were a little hesitant about staying here. I'm happy to report, we were pleasantly surprised! Perfectly situated in San Francisco's busy tourist area of Union Square, this hotel was only a short walk (downhill!) to many tourist attractions: shopping, cable cars and more important, the public transport systems (BART and MUNI) at Powell St. There was a fun bar (The White Horse) two doors down, a liquor store right next door and a Walgreens, a short walk away; all necessities when booking a hotel in my opinion. The boutique hotel has a small lobby, but is quite large once inside. The hotel is a memorial to past Marine service and a service to current Marines; so the hotel is a Marine museum and we saw many Marines (past and present) on the premises. Our standard room was small; but very clean with all the standard hotel amenities. Our friends were staying in the Deluxe rooms and Suites; which were both VERY spacious; so if being able to spread out is important to you; I would opt for a Deluxe room. The (Bridal) Suite was enormous with a full sized living room, separate bedroom and separate bath area/toilette area. Definitely worth it for a special occasion. Included in our standard room rate, we received complimentary full buffet breakfast and "happy hour" cocktails. Both were fabulous. The breakfast buffet was traditional breakfast buffet with eggs, sausages, French toast etc. with all kinds of breads, pastries and fruit, coffee tea and juice. The happy hour from 4-6 included complimentary beer, wine and cocktails and was such a generous amenity. Worth the price of the room, right there! As the hotel is geared at the service community; as expected, there are many older couples and families staying here; so don't expect partying in the halls (or if it was going on, we didn't see it/hear it). My friend also hosted her wedding here; and I can say that the cocktail area and dining room were spacious and very classically beautiful. The service we experienced at the front desk, diningâ€™s rooms and event staff were absolutely lovely. However, because this is a boutique hotel; expect to call for reservations (and make note of your own confirmation numbers; no email confirmation here); and expect the front desk to get a little busy, we called several times to no answer; but the staff themselves are absolutely fabulous. Also, I advise booking early, as this place sells out very quickly!

Reviews.Title: “Its a great 'boutique' hotel and the best kept secret in the best location in SF”
Reviews.Author: Paoball
Reviews.Content: So many of the big chain hotels are in the same area.. all are pricey but the MMC is a totally Not-for-Profit operation and very reasonably priced. For any one who has a USMC connection, they will completely enjoy the hotel's memorabilia and museum. For those w/o connection to USMC, they'll enjoy the full breakfast buffet, professional servers and the best FREE happy hour for guests each nite. Free happy hour too! Leave a nice tip since the servers are really good and that's their living! There is a gym for guests too although I didn't get to it. Its a big ragged on the edges but quite acceptable and again.. (small bathrooms) but you cannot beat the location on Sutter and Powell. Nob Hill is one direction, Chinatown and Union Hill in another direction, cable cars are everywhere and the dining everywhere is terrific. Best news.. all the profit goes to maintaining the memorial and hotel and various USMC charities. Very accommodating for physically disabled

Reviews.Title: “We had the best time ever!”
Reviews.Author: silentx
Reviews.Content: The hotel was gorgeous from the foyer to the rooms. Every night we had complimentary cocktails on the top floor with great views of the city and a piano player. In the morning we enjoyed a wonderful buffet breakfast also on the top floor. It was the best ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel, with great extras”
Reviews.Author: jam536
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week during a conference. At first, I wasn't impressed but as the week went on, I became a fan of this place. Favorite thing was the FREE hot breakfast buffet every morning. Wait staff was very attentive. You just need to leave a tip. Additionally there is a FREE happy hour in the evening, again, only tip required. The room was spacious and the hotel itself, is convenient to lots of shopping, restaurants, and many modes of transportation. Only 2 negatives - 1. Requested a wake-up call and never received it. 2. Don't expect the bell man to help you get a taxi. He basically told me I had to get one myself. So i walked about 3 blocks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fitness center and business center”
Reviews.Author: TCARBONNEL
Reviews.Content: Off course, it is a bit special to stay in a marine memorial hotel. However, it was a very good experience : - staff and concierge are helpfull - rooms are clean - breakfast is excellent, great choice and very good view on the city - fitness center is unique : a lot of appliance, plus a real swimming pool : 25 yards ! - good business center. The hotel decoration is old fashioned, then does not expect a design hotel, this is the only weak point in my opinion. Location is very convenient, close to Union Square a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, but...”
Reviews.Author: UDesideri
Reviews.Content: On holiday with my family, I followed the reviews on Tripadvisor and reserved the MMC for three nights. All true: great location in the city, large and really comfortable room with pieces of furniture of the 60s and 70s (exactly the contrary of a boutique hotel), very good service, very good complimentary breakfast and also great value for all of this, and very clean, too Why the "but..." in the title ? As Europeans, we were really a little intimidated by the thousands of pictures of Marines who received honors and died while servicing the USA. All the times we got back to our suite, we felt really sorry for all those young faces on the walls and all those memoranda which are exposed everywhere, and the mood when thinking about all those people who lost their lives was obviously not so happy for a holiday stay. If you are prepared for all of this, it is really a great choice and has a great value for what it offers. And it deserves all the best comments that are given on Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jemaher1959
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze but they forget to tell you that you need a credit card or they hold $100 a day for incidentals plus the room charge. The room was nice but dated. Would have liked to have been offered a room with a view instead of a alleyway. The room was nice but was kind of expecting more. A little on the small side but then again this is downtown San Francisco. Very well located only 3 blocks from Union Square and 2 blocks from trolly line. The Leatherneck Steakhouse was very nice. The dinner menu was well balanced and had many choices. The included breakfast buffet was great. A wide selection of items that even included SOS. Will be staying here again next time in town!

Reviews.Title: “Truly convivial”
Reviews.Author: Gulfman6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Marine's Memorial and have always found it to be a truly convivial and friendly experience. I suspect that this is due to a great extent on both the behavior of the guests and staff. There is a true and sincere civility and respect shown by both guests and staff. The "happy hour" is always good fun and the breakfast is always up to par. The historical aspect of the hotel gives the guest an impression of truly being in a San Francisco of another time. The rooms are generally all in good condition and spacious and the housekeeping does an excellent job. The location for either business or leisure travelers is superb. In the end however I think a guest will like the hotel for the calm an serene aura it projects. "Semper Fei"

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay and such a wonderful welcome”
Reviews.Author: QueenieRoadie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem! Perfect location and great service. We were the only British people in the hotel at the time we stayed, the rest of the guests seemed to be older people and all were lovely and chatty. The staff are fabulous with a special mention to Troy who was the most helpful concierge we have come across. Special place and good to support a worthy cause as they are a non profit making organisation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: DST1987
Reviews.Content: We stayed there when we took our daughter on a special trip. The staff were extremely helpful with everything from restaurant suggestions, directions (they provided us with a map several times), and were pleasant and made sure that our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. Our room was comfortable. I do suggest taking ear plugs in case your room faces the street. It was very noisy late in the evening and early in the morning. The bathroom was small but manageable. Breakfast is included and it was delicious. Buffet style that had different options each morning. Happy hour was also included every afternoon from 4-6pm. Each floor had lots of military memorabilia to read and enjoy. The library was fantastic. If you have ever had any association with the military, you will want to stay here. It's a very nice hotel for the price and in a great location to many activities in downtown. The historical artifacts, the wall paying tribute to those who gave their life during the Iraq and Afganistan wars, and superior customer service provided by the hotel staff make this a place we will stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Your Grandpa will Love It”
Reviews.Author: ThatGuyThom
Reviews.Content: This value hotel is centrally located in Union Square within walking distance of ACT, lots of shopping and transportation...in addition to a very aggressive homeless population. Service was consistently good, especially with the front desk who were always pleasant and helpful. Concierge a bit less so. To clarify, he provided basic directions but no "step above service". Rooms are dated and horribly decorated (those mustard towels have got to go) but comfortable. The oft changing weather was easily addressed by opening windows, ceiling fans or the a/c. Bed was comfortable and piled high with an obscene (but appreciated) amount of pillows. We were attending a conference which was "catered" so I feel I can address the food which was my only sub-par comment. There never seemed to be enough and the food was less than inviting. Literally something you would expect grandma to plate (slices of cold cuts, white bread, limited condiments and potato salad). In all fairness maybe this is what our company paid for but I personally could have done more with a trip to the local grocery store and $100. The military connection is strong and the memorials in the halls and on the 10th(?) floor are definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and fantastic location in Downtown San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: The_Milburns
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July 2011. For us this was great value as the hotel gave us a superb rate due to being British Military. The room was fantastic and the staff are extremely helpful. Highlights are the breakfast and the daily hour hour on the 12th floor with fantastic views over the city. Free laundry facilities and wifi were well received. Parking costs $27 per night but the parking garage is very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bchappellwmpd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The staff was wonderful and friendly. The hotel is located near all of the shopping and one block away you can catch a trolly to Fisherman Wharf. The breakfast buffet was wonderful way to start your day. After shopping and seeing the attractions all day they have a complimentary happy hour. The rooms are nice, but the bathrooms are small. Everything was clean and they do have washer and dryers on the premises. Just a great place to stay in San Francisco and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure in the heart of San Fransisco”
Reviews.Author: kenshiho
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights. I had not read any reviews and was very pleasently surprised. It felt like going back in time to Hitchkock's Vertigo. The location is superb, just smack in the middle of this jewel of cities. Street noise was not a problem. I loved the rooms, romantically retro. Clean, comfortable, great housekeeping. There was happy hour every day. What I liked the most about this hotel was the ample breakfast with a great view of the city. The hotel staff were very nice and friendly I think this is a very romantic hotel for couples but will suit families with children. This sure will be my hotel of choice in San Francisco. I loved the city but really loved this hotel that made my stay special.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place”
Reviews.Author: LinJoe-11
Reviews.Content: I don't know if too many people know about this "goldmine" find. I can't imagine going anywhere else in San Francisco. First, it's located right in the middle of all the attractions...just blocks from China Town. The lobby is like walking into a glamerous hotel yet I can't believe how reasonable their rates are compared to other hotels with equal amenities. They have a cocktail hour in the afternoon serving any drink of your choice along with wonderful snacks all in a rooftop floor overlooking the city & bay. On the same floor, every morning included in the rate, is a spread of breakfast items that any other hotel would charge $15 and up. It's simply amazing. They have no parking available but have connections to a garage just a couple of blocks down at a reduced rate of around $25/day. The desk was always pleasant and helpful in our planning of seeing their city and I really can't recommend them enough.

Reviews.Title: “Loaded with extras”
Reviews.Author: TowsonHounds
Reviews.Content: Excellent complimentary Breakfast Buffet and Happy Hour. Great service and clean room with other amenities made our stay a great value with an historic atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super value and even takes pets!”
Reviews.Author: MontyPy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times. Military rates are less and amazingly affordable! Just blocks from wharf and china town. Staff is pleasant and professional. Food is very good. Complimentary champagne evening receptions and morning breakfast buffet. Views from 12th floor dining room are best in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Will be our hotel of choice in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: toontownrider
Reviews.Content: read some of the older reviews and can only say - you can't please everyone. We stayed here for 5 nights on 9th fl at front of hotel. Street noise in early am was apparent but not terrible - earplugs would help. We thought the rooms were great - clean, comfortable, not overly large but ok; housekeeping was great; all staff were very friendly and courteous; free drinks at happy hour every day; we really liked the breakfasts - scrambled eggs, hashbrowns, pancakes/blinis, bacon/sausage, tons of fresh fruits, cereals, oatmeal, croissants etc. Don't know what else you would want for free. All hotel staff were extremely courteous and friendly; great gym with lap pool - free for guests! Marine Corps history was very interesting. Probably not a hotel for families with younger children, but it will be our hotel of choice in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Fifi58
Reviews.Content: The Marines Memoral Hotel is a very good value for the Union Square area. Even tho it is technically not right on Union Square, it is a very short walk to the square and shopping. It is in a good neighborhood with convenient restaurants nearby (diners, Starbucks, etc.). San Francisco can be very expensive. For example, you may find a hotel with a cheaper rate, but, parking in San Francisco is REALLY EXPENSIVE. There is a hotel in the same block that had a cheaper base rate, but their parking for one night is $59. If you have an oversized vehicle such as a truck or large SUV, you pay more. So, the Marines Memorial has a deal with a self-park garage on the same block for $25 for 24 hours. This hotel has a wonderful breakfast buffet, which is included in the room rate. There was a big selection of fruit, bagels, breads, french toast, potatoes, oatmeal, cereals, and much more. The only selection that I didn't care for too much was the scrambled eggs. But, the rest was excellent. Coffee was provided in a carafe which was left on the table and the wait staff refilled the orange juice numerous times. They were very attentive. There was a happy hour between 4 p.m. and 6 p.m. and it was complimentary. The bar area was small, but we were allowed to use the tables in the restaurant area and enjoy the view from the top floor. Our bedroom was small at the very end of the hall near the service area and ice maker and I thought we were doomed to a very noisy night ( it was one queen bed). But, it was very quiet. Even tho the room was small (from the hotel room chart, it appeared the all other rooms on the floor was larger) it was appointed nicely. There were nice soaps and the tub/show was nice and lots of hot water. The bed was a bit hard for my liking but that is subjective. All-in-all a very nice stay. I would say it is a great value...not many other hotels will provide such a big buffett breakfast and happy hour. Oh, and if you have a military background, you will enjoy all of the momentos and displays throughout the hotel. There is a great library also.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy in the mornings”
Reviews.Author: The_Fatts
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely central to everything and makes it convenient. Room is average probably outdated as they still use shower curtains for showers. After a shower the floor is all wet. The one thing that I didn't appreciate was woken up at 9 to the sound of housekeeping outside my door vacuuming, bumping into things, loud talking. It's only 9 and I'm trying to sleep, not the best hotel if you cant even sleep in some peace and quiet

Reviews.Title: “Great history”
Reviews.Author: Okorbut
Reviews.Content: Rooms a little small and stuffy. Great free breakfast and happyhour plus use of fitness club with pool. This hotel is mainly for servicemen and is more expensive for the general public but everyone was really friendly and the sense of history from all the memorabilia is great. Stay here of you have a respect for all things military and soak up the atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely accommodations and great people”
Reviews.Author: godwinshelley
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here regularly over the last 10 years. They always take great care of us - even keep a record of our preferred room and automatically put us in it when we call if it is open. They always treat us well and I suspect they treat their staff well too. I'm happy to see the same faces when I check in and when I eat in their Leatherneck Lounge. I especially appreciate being able to use their washers and dryers free - they even give you detergent at the front desk. It makes my packing easier knowing I can wash out a few things part way through my trip. Their free breakfast is hot, plentiful and wonderful with the added bonus of a birds nest view looking out onto the city towards the bay. If you are in a rush, you can grab a cup of coffee/tea and a pastry in their business office on the 4th floor - near their laundry. I won't mention the Happy Hour perk of free rail drinks for guests every day. I don't want it to get too crowded!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect-O”
Reviews.Author: LTVL
Reviews.Content: We are members but this was our first time to stay at the property. Great locay in Union Square..within walking distance to all eats and Cable Car stop. We had Room 610 which was very large and had 2 queens for 3 of us. The room was in good shape and spotless-the bathroom was small..but adequate. Plenty of hot water and towels. The complimentary amenities included in the rate are wonderful.. buffet breakfast, cocktails, gym, self laundry..it is very clean and perfect for 3 days in the City! I would stay here again by all means..no hotel value compares..and the service is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good freebies!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuddy010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in March. We don't have any military connection but a friend who had stayed here 5 years earlier, recommended it. The hotel was in a great location close to cable cars, shops, and bus routes so it was very easy to get around. The interior of the hotel is a little dated but we found it good value for our stay. We hardly spent much time in the room anyway - it was more important to us to have a great location than a luxurious room. There is a business centre in the hotel so you can use the internet for free. You can also use the laundry facilities for free as well. In addition, the hotel provides free laundry detergent. It was nice to have these extras provided and not have to pay for them. The best thing about the stay was Happy Hour on the 12th floor from 4 to 6pm. The dining room had a fabulous view over the city and it was great to be able sit there and order free drinks - spirits, wine, beer & cocktails! The staff were very friendly and helpful, and were happy to spend time telling you about San Fran and answering questions. I understand that accommodation in San Fran is quite expensive so if you are looking for somewhere that is good value, centrally located with a number of freebies thrown in, then I suggest you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: radsman
Reviews.Content: Good location. The common areas are in fine condition. The extras that came with the hotel were nice... free hot breakfast. Full gym and lap pool downstairs. The rooms were in a bit of disrepair though. Nothing major but it was several little things which that detracted from this being a truly 'nice' hotel. It seems that it lacked the 'attention to detail' that you would expect from a military hotel. If you are paying the member price, I suppose you can't beat it. If you're paying full price, I'm sure you could do better in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy Fun!”
Reviews.Author: TariTari
Reviews.Content: Wow! This hotel was quite the find in San Francisco! We decided to upgrade to a suite upon check in and never looked back! The desk clerk was more-than-accomodating by letting us check in early, then issuing us keys to both our reserved standard room and to a suite so we could look at them before deciding whether to upgrade. Exploring the hotel was half of our memories from the trip! Meeting other guests at the happy hour was true fun and exploring the hotel / museum / library / memorial wall was awe-inspiring. Yes, the decor is a bit old style, but that only helps to outline that you are in a place celebrating history; kinda adds to the charm. When we opened our suite door, I felt like I was stepping into Nixon's living room (so the furnishings are a bit 70's ish, but it is gilted 70's.) We usually try to avoid "cookie cutter" hotels when we travel, and this one breaks the mold! Breakfast each morning is a great perk, too and the hours are long enough that you can still catch breakfast even after recovering from the generous happy hour the night before! Also, there is a piano player at happy hour - very nice touch! Hopefully you'll get Patty as your bartender at happy hour because she is fantastic, helpful, and a joy to hang out with for a couple hours! As others have mentioned, the view is phenominal from the restaurant / bar. We ate at Leathernecks one night and it was a great meal and a romantic time. There is also a nice business center and I believe a guest laundry. Another perk is the use of the full health club on the bottom floor of the building - but unfortunately I can't tell you how that was - even though I had intented to use it everyday, I never set foot in the place. We can't wait to return - and next time we'll bring the kids so they can explore the hotel and take in all the history.

Reviews.Title: “Room quallity gets worse each time I stay there”
Reviews.Author: Joseph777
Reviews.Content: I am a MMC member and have a lot or pride in this facilty. I stay in the hotel portion of the MMC a few times a year while on business in San Franciaco. The rooms are in need of some quality control. Should the window latches always be broken? Should burned out light bulbs need to be repalced? Does the breakfast hostess need to be so rude? Does something have to be wrong with the room - Everytime I stay there? Next time I'm in San Fran I am going to find another hotel. Please get the hotel portion back to where it should be. SF.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Go Wrong”
Reviews.Author: travelersK&W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights the first week in January. What can I say, great location and great value. The morning breakfast and evening happy (2) hour were great. The location is fantastic and convenient to cable cars, sights and other public transportation. I would highly recommend staying here and enjoying the hotel. The rooms are not luxurious but they are clean and pretty well maintained. New mattresses were being installed when we were there. All rooms already have new flat panel televisions.. The view from the top floor is amazing. Don't miss it. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location trumped by marvelous service and happy hour”
Reviews.Author: godwinshelley
Reviews.Content: We have been staying here regularly - and have enjoyed it each time. The location is near many restaurants, on a bus line, walking distance to the cable car, near the convention center and across the street from a UPS store (so I can mail home my many purchases). The desk help has always been helpful. The breakfast is welcome and very filling while the complimentary happy hour is not only a wonderful deal but offers a stunning view of the city skyline down to the water. We love it and return as often as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kjtraveler2008
Reviews.Content: I travel to SF a lot for work and have never stayed at this hotel or even heard of it. I was recently in a wedding that was at the Marines Memorial Club Hotel so we stayed there with the rest of the wedding party. PROS: Location is perfect, right in Union Square. Quiet and cozy rooms. Amazing FREE brunch for all guests. Restaurant is on the top of the building with spectacular views and even better food. This was a nice surprise; we had brunch there every morning! CONS: It's just as expensive as the nicer hotels in SF. No bell man to help hail cabs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A Sanctuary in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: I82X73
Reviews.Content: The Marine Memorial Club Hotel is my sanctuary and sanity station in the city of San Francisco. From the moment you walk through the door, you feel as though you are instantly welcome and respected. Of course, part of this comes from the fact that it is military-oriented, so those of us who are veterans feel at home. The staff is always cheerful and supportive of your needs, and by your second day, most of the staff recognizes and remembers you. The facility, located one block of the Union Square area at the corner of Sutter and Mason, is a Beau Arts style building that has been lovingly restored and updated over the years by the Marine Memorial Association, and, as the name implies, it is actually a Memorial. The lobby is nice with various displays in cases along the walls. A businees center is located on the fourth floor, where various suites are located. A wonderful library and two banquet rooms are located on floor 11 and the Leatherneck lounge / restaurant is on floor 12 (with wonderful views of the city). The rooms are very comfortable with ductless air conditioning and an overhead fan, so temperatures can be adjusted easily. The rooms are tastefully decorated. A small refrigerator, coffee maker, safe, iron and ironing boad are present. A comfortable desk is there and an excellent wireless internet connection is available. The staff is wonderful. Many have worked there for years. When is the last time your housekeeper recognized you, said good morning and wished you a good day when you left your room each day? Our breakfast waiters knew who we were and knew our preferances for breakfast drinks. A free full breakfast buffet is provided each morning -- if you can't find something to eat, something is wrong with you. Lunch and dinner is available and the dinner menu is great. A free social hour is provided daily. Access to a health club is available. In short, this is a wonderful place to stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: armyhusker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a couple of nights. Great location, beautiful historic hotel, museum like exhibits. Awe-inspiring. Staff worked hard to make stay memorable and were extremely helpful hailing cabs, make dinner suggestions and assisting with directions in the city. Great complimentary full buffet American breakfast as well as complimentary happy hour. As active duty member will continue to be a member, not only for the great value of staying here, but for the awesome job they are doing representing the Marines and other military branches.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lots of inclusions....”
Reviews.Author: wingriderAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in a king room on the fifth floor facing Sutter Street. The rate includes a lot of things that are 'extras' elsewhere such as breakfast, internet, safe, gym, cocktails, snacks...... It is in a great location close to a lot of attractions. So, for a downtown hotel it is very good value. We booked online with the hotel site and the rate was reasonable but not the 'club' rate. The staff are good and helpful. We did have one slack breakfast server though... The hotel definitely has an 'ambience' that is unique and the military history is everywhere. There are some things to mention though.... our room had a big crack in the basin and a big stain on the carpet, it was getting a bit worn and the bedding was pretty ordinary compared to other comparable hotels we have stayed in this trip. It was also stuffy as there is no extraction system but this goes with older hotel buildings. This hotel seems to have a regular following and on balance we can see why as it provides a 'different' experience to your usual vanilla hotel! Good luck and enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back! Great Hotel and Amenities!!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterwanabes
Reviews.Content: My only disappointment is that we only had a one night stay at this great hotel in downtown SF. I didn't learn about this place until recently by another friend in the Navy who strongly recommended this for military people and their families and wow what a place. This Hotel not only a great place to stay but also has lots of history with it as well. It is a "living memorial" for all those who have served in the military around the world. So all in all just a one night stay but would love to be here for a week to explore San Francisco. There are no negatives for this review here are all the positives: - Location: in the heart of downtown San Francisco located within walking distance to all the sights downtown. -Free complimentary internet/ free gym pass at the attached gym with lap pool. Complimentary happy hour with free drinks and breakfast ( which we did not get to try). -Business center. -Comfortable rooms with flat screen TV/ refrigerator/comfortable bed/ nice bathroom with great water pressure. -11th floor has a historic library with array of different military books and newspapers. We will be back! Can recommend this place enough. Tip on eatiing We had Sushi at the Sanraku restaurant just up the street on Summit from the hotel. Great Sushi and service! Tip on Hertz rental car: avoid if you can the 550 OFarrell Hertz rental car. Terrible service! Avoid if you can given the headache of dealing with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: pentangle
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this property. Rates are great and even better if you are in the Armed Forces. The fact that I am a Reserve Officer, in the Canadian Forces, makes no difference to them - I am given the same rates as an American service member. What makes this place so wonderful - the staff. Attentive, genuinely concerned about the well being of the guests and very helpful. One of the best breakfasts that I have had in a North American hotel. Happy hour is a great way to end the work day and the opportunity is there to interact with other guests if one is so inclined. The library is awesome and a place to relax. A well equipped public gym in the basement. I'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is First Class!”
Reviews.Author: Airtraffic
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (teenagers) just spent 10 great days in San Fran. The staff were amazing. Gary and Troy were the most helpful concierges. Free full-all you can eat breakfast and the free happy happy happy hours was just icing on the cake after a long day of sightseeing. Servers in the breakfast room/bar were very attentive and polite. The waiters even packed a "brunch to go" for us to take to The OutsideLands Music Festival" Cleaning staff were friendly and thorough. Hotel is situated in an ideal location. Just a couple blocks from Union Square (shopping), Chinatown, cablecars, and maybe 5-6 blocks from the BART. Access to public transportation is right across the street. 15min-20 min bus ride to many local attractions. Golden Gate Park, Fishersman Wharf, Presido, Alcatraz, Coit tower, Haight/Ashbury and AT& T Park. The hotel and room was a "bit" dated but that's part of the charm. Hotel was full of memorials and memorabilia from America's war heroes. Just visting all the history on the various floors and museum was a treat in itself. My girls liked visiting the bulldogs (hotel mascots) every morning for a belly rub and ear scratch.I would challenge anyone to find a nicer hotel for $159.00 a night that feeds a family of 4 a delicious full breakfast and offers free cocktails to adults within 50 miles of downtown San Fran. Thanks to the staff of The Marine Club for making our stay very very enjoyable. FYI Rent a car and head to Muir Woods. Petumula Bay and Bodega Bay for a sightseeing and discount mall shopping day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in San Francisco!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NeverStop1432
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at the Hotel, but we did have dinner at the Leathernecks Steakhouse. One word: WOW! We LOVED it. It is a smaller venue, with a great view of the city, a piano being played, great little bar. The service was impeccable, the food was OUTSTANDING. We had the small fillet, cooked medium, and a Rib-eye, cooked Med-Rare to Med. They were PERFECT the first time. The sides were excellent. The wedge salad was killer. All for a VERY reasonable price. We are not members of the "club" there, but now that the hotel and restaurant are open to the public, this is GREAT place. Love the old memorabilia and pride in our armed services. Will look forward to staying at the hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value if you are a Member”
Reviews.Author: Loves_to_Travel_008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in San Francisco and on a whim decided to make a night of it. Since he is a member of the Marines Memorial Club, we were able to get a great room here at a very reasonable price for downtown San Francisco. The service was great, everyone was very helpful. The room was big, along with the bathroom and there was an abundance of soap, shampoo and conditioner available in the bathroom. They have a gym and a pool that is great and my husband talks of going back and working out next time we're there. There's also a small commissary type store downstairs as well. Parking was available at a nearby parking garage for $25 (I believe), which is more than we wanted to pay for parking, but it was very convenient considering the location. Breakfast was included in our price and it was VERY nice. The breakfast room is on the top floor overlooking the city. There was a wide selection of food and drinks and we were both pleased with breakfast. We are definitely planning on going back. It is an older hotel which could use some upgrades, but is a great value if you're a member.

Reviews.Title: “Marines Memorial”
Reviews.Author: JovanT
Reviews.Content: Top notch service, free breakfast, and I mean breakfast!!! Great location, and cant beat the price with the surrounding areas! Off the chain, real deal customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel--unbelieveable convenience”
Reviews.Author: doublek3534
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the MMC for business and it was tremendously easy to check in, host professional drinks on the 12th floor, and to park. It is a clean place to stay, so convenient for restaurants and Union Square. Would recommend to anyone! 12th floor view is unbelieveable and the staff treats you like family. Fitness center in basement is first class--- 25 yard pool is essential to any swimmer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: madmax25
Reviews.Content: Extended our time by staying here one night. Enjoyed the happy hour and the great breakfast the next morning. Staff as usual very helpful. Enjoyed the city and the cable cars. Room was nice and with a corner we had two sets of windows we could open to hear the sounds of the city and get a nice breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Union Square area”
Reviews.Author: Gator-Globe-Trotter
Reviews.Content: we recently had a great experience staying at the Marinesâ€™ Memorial Club in downtown San Francisco. I found the place unexpectedly, searching for something a bit different in the Union Square area. My whole family has served in the US Military at one time or another and I was curious about the Marinesâ€™ Memorial and what it had to offer. Well, you dont have to be in the military to stay there. I have to tell you itâ€™s a great find, next to Union Square and the cable cars, with wonderful staff and nice guestrooms. While itâ€™s true the rooms arenâ€™t as glitzy and glamorous as some of the hotels, they are spacious and comfortable, scrupulously clean and with all the amenities like free Internet, flat screen TVâ€™s and the best thing a terrific breakfast buffet with EVERYTHING you could want PLUS two hours of happy hour every day. What a steal! And, as if that isnâ€™t enough, you get access to a really terrific health club. To top it off, thereâ€™s a live pianist that plays most nights in the top floor restaurant and steakhouse. Itâ€™s a terrific restaurant with a reasonably priced menu, lots of choices and fantastic views of downtown and Union Square. I would recommend this facility to anyone interested in something a bit unique with some history, ambiance and really nice people that work there.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!!”
Reviews.Author: biztrvlr89
Reviews.Content: Tiny, dark dirty rooms that looked like your granmothers apartment in 1952. Horrible mattress and sheets and towels that seemed like they have been in the room since 1952. Customer service is horrible. Overall awful place...good location but that is really about all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pentangle
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem. Not as much for the rooms, which are a bit worn out, but because of the location, history, hospitality and great staff. The rooms are basic and with a 1960s brown and beige I was on business, for the US governement, so on top of the federal government rate I received a further discount as a member of the Canadian Forces Reserve and saved Uncle Sam a lot of money. When I checked in there was an odd smell, to the room, an ionizer running and all the windows were open. I must have got used to the smell but upon my return the next afternoon, the smell was stronger. Without any fuss I was moved to an equivalent room. The staff were warm and friendly. The library, on the 11 floor, is well worth the stay. The breakfast buffet, which is included, is excellent. A full private membership gym, with up to date equipment, is located in the basement. Would I stay here again - yes - and plan to this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Kolea5
Reviews.Content: Our 3-night stay was surprisingly nice--I thought Union Square would be overpriced and touristy-lame. As retired military we joined the club to get a price break and reciprocity for other military hotels--the hotel staff tells you the break-even point for yr stay. Our 2-double bed room was not especially roomy but we were able to fit in a cot for our 3rd child at no charge. Housekeeping was quite cheery about our requests for extra towels, etc., and the room was tidied nicely. The breakfast buffet was everything other reviewers have mentioned, and a super way to start the day. The kids discovered the delights of strawberry cheese blintzes one morning. The room didn't seem tired, though it was a bit dusty. I thought the bathroom was fine. Other good things: the large soap/shampoo/condit. dispensers in the shower, good thermostat control, free wi-fi in room, nice views, comfy reading chair, convenient location, 6am coffee & scones in business center. We walked 5 blocks to Market & Powell where we found the SF visitor center (very helpful), and SF Shopping Centre (big mall w/ pretty good food court). It's an easy place to catch the cable car, BART & Muni (bus) around town. We took the Muni to Golden Gate park very easily (the CA Academy of Science rocked!). I can't think of a reason NOT to stay at the hotel again. Beautiful, historic, convenient, great price, and a friendly staff. When we checked in I mentioned that our hospitality card only noted 4 and I would need to purchase a buffet ticket for my 3rd child. She waved that off, changed the ticket to 2 adults and 3 kids, and off we went to our room. So great. p.s. There's a dress code for dinner, not unreasonable. Street noise was a problem for the light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Magnificant Meeting and Ball Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Prayzur
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marines Memorial Club Hotel for a business conference I was speaking at. I was highly impressed with the elegance of the meeting and conference rooms. I could only imagine how nice a wedding or special event would be in this location. As a visitor, I found the location very convenient. I was able to catch the cable car to the pier right outside the hotel. I would recommend this as a romantic getaway or conference venue. The dinner/breakfast was great and the view from the 13th floor restaurant was magnificent at both sunrise and sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoMD
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here on several occasions while on active duty. I was in town for a professional meeting but decided to take some extra days and bring my wife who had never actually seen the sights of San Francisco, only the airport. The hotel is near Union Square and convenient to Chinatown and the business district. The rooms are large and comfortable but do show a little age around the margins. Still a great bargain for the price. The staff is helpful and attentive. Breakfast buffet was included in the room price and extensive. We ate in the 12th floor restaurant one night. The menu is that of a relatively expensive steakhouse such as Ruth Chris's. The portions were large and delicious. Next time we return to SFO , we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't skip this one!”
Reviews.Author: Carsie_Travels
Reviews.Content: The MMC was a great place to stay on our recent business and leisure travel to San Francisco. It's an easy short walk to Union Square, and the Powell Street cable cars. The hotel is an older building, but nicely appointed and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. The 12th floor breakfast (included) was on the caliber of a $25-30 buffet every morning per person! It had a beautiful presentation including breakfast meats, fruit, egg dishes, pastries, hot breakfast entrees, as well as all the usual continental fare. The service and quality were like an impeccable club. Dinner recommendations were great from the doorman. It felt like a very luxury experience for a VERY reasonable price by downtown San Francisco standards. Don't pass this one by! The Marine Memorial displays are tasteful and very interesting, but not overpowering--worth the history while staying in a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome deal!”
Reviews.Author: uesgirl1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marines Memorial Hotel for the first time over Labor Day weekend. The location of the hotel was fantastic (close to shopping, walking distance to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf, FInancial District, etc.). The rooms were clean, but a little bit dated. Complimentary breakfast was offered every day, along with FREE happy hour between 4-6pm! For $80/night, what's not to love??

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: dgdeppen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. The staff, the location, the rooms. Perfect. Free Breakfast, and I mean a real breakfast. Free Happy Hour every night. And walking distance within everything. You would be a fool to stay any where else. This place could charge ten times what they are and people would stay here. Semper Fi!

Reviews.Title: “A Salute to the value and service an Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ptb2929
Reviews.Content: Marines Memorial Club is one terrific place to stay. What a VALUE !! Years ago came here and have observed some remarkable changes and improvements. Most noticeable - is the staff â€“ each and every hotel staffer treats the guests like â€œguestsâ€�. Refreshing concept in America today. At each job bellman to waiter they are professional. It is always a pleasure to witness professionalism regardless of their job â€“ they are professional. The amenities and no nonsense charges are gratifying. Free laundry, internet, full buffet breakfast, and free happy hour cocktails, as well as no charges for local & 800 calls, comp newspapers et cetera make this on high value stay. Firm mattresses, strong warm showers, good towels, cable TV and basics which all WORK â€“ OOO RRAH - better than the last Ritz Carlton, where I stayed overseas. Plus it is an honor to stay at a locale so rich in U S Marine history. A tour of the club â€™s history and displays is a MUST. A moment in which to be proud â€“ Semper Fidelis. Well Done to the Marine Memorial Clubâ€™s Management Team !! Keep up the good work from a convert. Aloha nui loa, Marine Veteran from Hawaii

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: mikala37
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, especially for the price of the room and parking in SF! Great location, EXCELLENT customer service- throughout the hotel, good food, comp breakfast and happy hour. The room we stayed in was a typical size SF hotel room and more importantly it was clean. The only complaint I have is that our room seemed to back up to the laundry room and the washer or dryer was going on kind of late one night. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, safe, courtious hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: amarinewife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I come to Marine's Memorial every year for our anniversary in June. It is so clean and so convienent with a variety of restaruants, venues, and a short cab ride to Peir 39, Fisherman's Wharf, etc. We have a wonderful dinner at the House of Prime Rib, which is walking distance to the hotel. The hotel overall is just fabulous. There is Happy Hour, a wonderful breakfast with an awesome view of San Francisco too. The staff is very respectful. They are almost invisible unless you are in need of anything. Each room has a little library of books, in which you are allowed to take, read and return at a later date, which I thought was such a great, trustworthy, idea. No matter the time of year, I suggest making reservations earlier than you think. No matter what the critic's say, this is a 5 Star hotel! Great Service! Great Location! Great Food! Great Everything!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Got married here”
Reviews.Author: iv425
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married here and the service could not be better. We are both Active Duty military and members of the club. The rates for AD military are phenomenal! Not even the crappiest, cheapest motel in downtown SF can beat it. The American breakfast and happy hour drinks which come with the stay are an added bonus. The rooms are a but small and street noise can be heard, but you would get that with ANY hotel downtown, it's a bustling city. The ambiance of the hotel has a quaint 40s feel. The hotel does a great job of paying tribute to military heritage when most of it is lost in a liberal city like SF. The staff and caterers for our wedding were very helpful. They set up a great room block with reasonable rates for the non-military guests. I think everyone enjoyed their stay. The only complaint I would have is that the parking garage is pretty expensive. (What garage isn't in SF?)

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Best Service. Love this Place!”
Reviews.Author: klynnega
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times now and I love it!! The location is excellent, approximately 3 blocks from Union Square and cable cars and easy drive to Golden Gate Bridge/Sausalito. Restaurant/Lounge is on the 12th floor and has a beautiful view of the city. They offer full size 'to-go' cups for coffee in the morning if in a rush and service is wonderful as is breakfast assortment. The concierge and front desk are incredibly knowledgable about the city and how to get from point to point the easiest way possible. To your right of the hotel is an exquisite little italian restaurant with the most amazing food and on the left are several little markets/delis for quick and easy snacks to take up to your room or a day on the town. There are other and fancier hotels, but I would never stay anywhere else if this hotel has a room! Five stars in every way!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service for vets and active-duty alike”
Reviews.Author: theapp
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the spur of the moment on Christmas night, based off recommendations online and from friends that had stayed here. Was amazed at the quality of the location and services offered for the price. Members (yes, you must become a member in order to get the choice prices) receive a huge discount on stays at this location and numerous exchange locations, but the good thing is that active-duty military get free membership on-site. Not a bad deal. Our pet was welcome to stay with us (small extra fee--$12) and we received free cocktails during happy hour and a full breakfast the following morning. The bed was comfortable, the room was spotless, and the staff was most helpful. It is located near Central Square and within walking distance of China Town (two must-sees in San Francisco). Weekday rates are slightly lower than weekend rates, but both are extremely reasonable for the location. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value coupled with the Marine Corps experience”
Reviews.Author: Mike_in_Tampa
Reviews.Content: I have been a member of MMC for about 15 years and have stayed there nearly every time I have been in SF. The club continues to improve, particularly under the newer GM, MajGen Myatt, USMC Retired. The rooms have all been renovated as has the bar and restaurant on the top floor. I have also used their reciprocal clubs in Boston (Union Club) and Washington DC (Army Navy Club). The rooms are very nice, the breakfast buffet plentiful and the pours at happy hour generous. The staff is gracious, some having been there for 25 years. The hotel is in the heart of downtown, a short walk from the Bart and cable cars. The prices are a bargain for downtown SF if you are a member.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mrolfes
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location for a visit to SF. It is just a couple blocks from Union Square. Tons of great restaurants, both high end and cheap. The restaurant next door is great. Lots of nightlife, nightclubs, bars, shows. China Town is a few blocks away. You can walk to almost everything. If you are willing to take the bus, which I recommend fun people watching and very affordable, you can catch a bus to almost anywhere you want to go to in SF from this area as well. I can't say enough about the location. As far as the hotel goes, it is a GREAT deal if you are a member. If you are not a member than the price is still not bad. The rooms are basic, but comfortable. The beds and bedding above average. The bathrooms are small, but the closets are very big, walk in closets with a mini fridge and coffee maker. Everything is very practical-military. There is even a clothse line in the shower. The staff is wonderful and very helpful. The best part about the hotel is the top floor restaurant and bar. Great views of the city. The breakfast, included, is good. In the evening there is a happy hour, also included. If we weren't up to hanging out for happy hour we would grab some beers and put them in our mini fridge for later. If possible stay on a higher floor, because you are in the middle of the city, so there is street noise. I just brought earplugs and had no problems. Even if you are not a member, you can really save $$ by staying at this hotel with all the extras included. Remember this is not a fancy place, but very comfortable and convienent.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: 1lacrosse
Reviews.Content: I am proud to be a member of the Marine's Memorial Club, and always stay at this hotel when in San Francisco. On this trip, my wife and I were returning from a week in wine country, and rested in the San Francisco city center before returning back to Cincinnati. Besides being a wonderful living tribute to the Marines, the hotel is very accommodating to members and members of reciprical clubs, in addition to active members of the military. The Leatherneck Steak house serves wonderful steaks, and has a great open bar between 4-6 PM. It reminded me of many Officers Clubs that I have frequented over a long military career. I hope that you have the chance to stay here. Great internet connections and complimentary breakfast included. Semper Fi!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Abel73
Reviews.Content: The Marine's Memorial hotel is centrally located in downtown San Francisco, within walking distance of Chinatown, the Moscone convention center, cable car stops and many excellent restaurants and designer stores. The hotel itself has clean rooms with comfortable beds with nice conforter and soft pillows. The rooms are good size, but the bathrooms are small and towels are not very good quality. My room had no tub, just a shower which was fine for me. There is free internet access in every room, but for some reason I could never get my connection to work. There is complementary hot breakfast every morning and free cocktails from 4-6 pm every day at the hotel restaurant on the top floor. There is also a business center on the 4th floor with 4 PCs and a network printer which is very convenient. Another excellent amenity is free access to One Club (gym) in the basement. The full service fitness center has an indoor lap pool. The hotel overall has a dated feel to it, but it's central location, excellent amenites and friendly staff override any other negative aspect. I would definitly stay at the Marine Memorial's hotel on my next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: R0se_43
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in the Marinesâ€™ Memorial Club & Hotel since their recent room renovations. I stayed one night in February in a king room on a corner of the 9th floor. The view was lovely. The decor is light and pleasing, simple but pretty. The room was impeccably clean and had all of the amenities â€” shampoo etc. right in dispensers on the shower wall, 2 free 1/2 liter bottles of water, bathrobes, iron and ironing board, safe, etc. etc. My favorite thing about staying there, though, was how quiet the room was. This is worth its weight in gold in a downtown hotel. I think they must have new beds, too; my bed was very comfortable and I slept much better than I usually do away from home. This place is an amazing value for club members and non-members alike. The building is gorgeous, with amazing period ornamentation and painted ceilings in the public areas (lobby, etc.). The location a block from Union Square canâ€™t be beat. Parking is right up the street; you get a voucher that lets you take your car out and in again if you want. There are lots of Union Square hotels, but because this is part of a private club, when you walk through the doors, youâ€™re greeted like an old friend and you get the feeling the staff would do anything to make your stay memorable. What a difference that makes when any overnight stay in the City is a splurge, as it is for me. We unfortunately arrived after the hosted happy hour (included with the overnight stay) was over, but had a great meal in the steakhouse on the top floor. The breakfast buffet (also included) has EVERYTHING (eggs, bacon, potatoes, oatmeal, pancakes, cereal, yogurt, fruit, etc. etc.) and serves up a terrific view in the bargain. Good thing I got a workout in before tucking into that meal. A pass for Club One, downstairs, is also included. This is more than a hotel. They call it a â€œliving memorialâ€� and thereâ€™s a memorial wall on the 10th floor, historical displays in the lobby and the guest room floors, and a library/museum, all worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “City Noise!”
Reviews.Author: treking
Reviews.Content: Clean, dark, spacious room at a very reasonable price in Union Square. Beautiful view from dining room at pleasant breakfast. BUT WE ARE GROUCHY at breakfast, because, poor sound insulation deprived us of sleep. There isnâ€™t air conditioning. No need to close windows to exclude street noise and prevent cool air from refreshing the room. Sounds are the sameâ€¦with windows open or closed; LOUD and BOISTEROUS.

Reviews.Title: “Location/Parking Best Part”
Reviews.Author: AlohaHonolulu
Reviews.Content: Location is the best part of this hotel, close to Union Square, shopping and theaters. Also, great parking rates in comparison to other 3 star hotels. Rooms are basic, clean but nothing special. Rooms facing courtyard and other buildings are rather dark. Upstairs restaurant and bar are nice with a piano player. Breakfast when we stayed was a basic buffet (some fruit, some scrambled eggs, etc., nothing cooked to order). The staff were very nice. The entrance/lobby has some very interesting historic memorabilia. Basically, would rate this as a 2.5 to 3 star, with a small bathroom, clean bed, pleasant staff and great location. MIght stay here again, but only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great service”
Reviews.Author: lineab
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a meeting last week at the Marine Hotel, and I tagged along. The Marine Hotel is an unsung gem. For the meeting rate of $150 a night, we both got full American breakfast, a two hour cocktail reception in the afternoon, and use of Club One Fitness, a full-service gym on the ground level of the hotel. The room was quite nice. Service was great - very friendly, and after a couple days we felt like family. As long as one doesn't have a problem with the fairly heavy military influence, it's a lovely place to stay and a tremendous value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in the Centre of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: JohnWilson
Reviews.Content: This is an unusual hotel in so far as it is actually a private club open to the public. The clientele are generally retired Mraines and their families, and the ambience is military and perhaps a touch sombre. That said, the suite we occupied for 3 nights was clean, well laid out and comprehensively equipped. The decor was rather heavy on the browns and yellows and the bedrooms and public rooms could do with a makeover. But everything worked just fine. Breakfast was comprehensive and excellent value, there is a free Happy Hour in the bar in the early evening, and dinner and snacks were pleasant. The staff were without exception all friendly and helpful. The location is excellent : right by Union Square, with valet parking just up the street at a special rate. All-in-all the place is recommended for those who don't m nd a rather "dated" look to their hotel as a trade off for good value at a good location.

Reviews.Title: “We always choose the Marines”
Reviews.Author: caltravelerette
Reviews.Content: Our family has been using the Marines Memorial for about 15 years now and it just keeps improving. The rooms have been upgraded, the public spaces well maintained and the restaurant food is tastier. Our main reasons for staying loyal to this hotel are the great value and the wonderful staff.
